summary: In this context, buta-1,3-diene is mentioned as a volatile organic compound (VOC) analyzed in relation to environmental exposure, while the EPO gene is not directly referenced or discussed. There is no indication of a relationship between buta-1,3-diene and the EPO gene, as the focus is on urinary biomarker analyses related to air toxics without any mention of genetic implications or interactions with the EPO gene.
